query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
1 Sì tosto come l’ultima parola 2 la benedetta fiamma per dir tolse, 3 a rotar cominciò la santa mola;
query.error: **English:** 1 As soon as the last word 2 the blessed flame uttered to say this, 3 the holy millstone began to rotate;
query.result: 1 Yathā yathā uttamā padāvalī 2 Śubhā jvālā vaktuṃ abravīt, 3 Pavitraṃ cakram āvartanārambhāt.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
4 e nel suo giro tutta non si volse 5 prima ch’un’altra di cerchio la chiuse, 6 e moto a moto e canto a canto colse;
query.error: **English:** 4 and in its revolution it did not complete a full turn 5 before another circle enclosed it, 6 and movement by movement and song by song it kept pace;
query.result: 4 Evaṃ ca tasya āvartane pūrṇāṃ paribhramaṇaṃ na cakāra 5 Yāvat aparo maṇḍalaḥ tena saṃvṛtaḥ, 6 Gatiḥ gatyā saha, gītaṃ gītena saha ca samāptaṃ jātam.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
7 canto che tanto vince nostre muse, 8 nostre serene in quelle dolci tube, 9 quanto primo splendor quel ch’e’ refuse.
query.error: **English:** 7 a song that so surpasses our muses, 8 our sirens in those sweet pipes, 9 as the first splendor surpasses that which it rejects.
query.result: 7 Gītaṃ yat asmākaṃ mūṣāḥ atiśayati, 8 Madhurāsu veṇuṣu asmākaṃ śireṇaḥ, 9 Yathā prathamaḥ prakāśaḥ tena parityaktam prakāśam.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
10 Come si volgon per tenera nube 11 due archi paralelli e concolori, 12 quando Iunone a sua ancella iube,
query.error: **English:** 10 As through a tender cloud two bows arise, 11 parallel and of like colors, 12 when Juno commands her handmaid,
query.result: 10 Yathā komalābhre dve dhanuṣī bhavataḥ 11 samāntarāvabhinnavarṇāvapi, 12 yadā devī svakāryakāriṇīm ādiśati,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
13 nascendo di quel d’entro quel di fori, 14 a guisa del parlar di quella vaga 15 ch’amor consunse come sol vapori,
query.error: **English:** 13 the one born from the other, 14 in the manner of the speech of that fair lady 15 whom love consumed like the sun consumes vapors,
query.result: 13 antargatasya bahiḥsthitasya ca janmanaḥ, 14 tasyāḥ sundarīyāḥ kathana iva, 15 yām kāmaḥ prajvalayām āsa yathā sūryaḥ dhūmān,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
16 e fanno qui la gente esser presaga, 17 per lo patto che Dio con Noè puose, 18 del mondo che già mai più non s’allaga:
query.error: **English:** 16 and they make people here prescient, 17 because of the pact that God made with Noah, 18 that the world will never again be flooded:
query.result: 16 evaṃ ca lokān ihāgaminaḥ kurutaḥ, 17 yasmāt niyamāt parameśvaraḥ Noena saha samabhavata, 18 yaḥ pṛthivīm punarapi na jale magnām karoti:

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
19 così di quelle sempiterne rose 20 volgiensi circa noi le due ghirlande, 21 e sì l’estrema a l’intima rispuose.
query.error: **English:** 19 so did the two garlands of those eternal roses 20 revolve around us, 21 and so did the outermost answer to the innermost.
query.result: 19 evam tayor anantajīvinyor gulabayoḥ 20 āvām abhito dve mālāv abhavatām, 21 tathā ca bahiḥsthitā antargatāyai pratyuttaram adāt.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.

query.error: **English:** 22 After the jubilation and the other great feast, 23 both of singing and of glowing with light, 24 light with light, joyful and gentle,
query.result: 22 Tataḥ paramanandam anyām ca mahotsavam, 23 gāyanasya ca prakāśasya ca, 24 prakāśena prakāśena hṛṣṭānām ca mṛdūnām ca,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
25 insieme a punto e a voler quetarsi, 26 pur come li occhi ch’al piacer che i move 27 conviene insieme chiudere e levarsi;
query.error: **English:** 25 together in agreement and desire to be still, 26 just like the eyes that, for the pleasure that moves them, 27 must close and open together;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
28 del cor de l’una de le luci nove 29 si mosse voce, che l’ago a la stella 30 parer mi fece in volgermi al suo dove;
query.error: **English:** 28 from the heart of one of the new lights 29 a voice moved, which made the needle seem to me 30 to turn to its place as I turned to it;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
31 e cominciò: «L’amor che mi fa bella 32 mi tragge a ragionar de l’altro duca 33 per cui del mio sì ben ci si favella.
query.error: **English:** 31 and it began: "The love that makes me beautiful 32 draws me to speak of the other leader 33 through whom my leader is spoken of so well.
query.result: 31 ca ārabdhā: "Sa premaḥ yaḥ mama śobhāṃ janayati 32 mama anyasya netāraḥ kathanaṃ kartum ākarṣati 33 yena mama netāraḥ evam śobhanīyaḥ kathitaḥ.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
34 Degno è che, dov’ è l’un, l’altro s’induca: 35 sì che, com’ elli ad una militaro, 36 così la gloria loro insieme luca.
query.error: **English:** 34 It is fitting that where one is, the other should be brought: 35 so that, just as he to a military [man], 36 so their glory may shine together.
query.result: 34 Yatraikas tatra dvitīyo 'py ānayaḥ: 35 Yathā sa ekasmād vaiśyāya, 36 Tathā tayoḥ kīrtir eka eva prakāśatām.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
40 quando lo ’mperador che sempre regna 41 provide a la milizia, ch’era in forse, 42 per sola grazia, non per esser degna;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.

query.result: 46 Tasmin diśi yatra vāyuḥ saurabhaḥ 47 mṛdulaḥ prasphālayati navān pallavān 48 yair dṛśyate yūropā samāvṛtā,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
73 Ben parve messo e famigliar di Cristo: 74 che ’l primo amor che ’n lui fu manifesto, 75 fu al primo consiglio che diè Cristo.
query.error: **English:** 73 He appeared to be well-placed and a friend of Christ: 74 for the first love that was manifest in him 75 was at the first counsel that Christ gave.
query.result: 73 Saḥ su-sthitaḥ iva āsa kalyāṇa-mitraṃ ca Kṛṣṭasya: 74 yataḥ prathamo ratiḥ yaḥ tasmin abhavat prakāśaḥ, 75 saḥ ādiṣṭe prathame mante yaḥ Kṛṣṭeṇa dattaḥ.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
109 ben ti dovrebbe assai esser palese 110 l’eccellenza de l’altra, di cui Tomma 111 dinanzi al mio venir fu sì cortese.
query.error: **English:** 109 The excellence of the other, of whom Thomas 110 was so courteous to me before my coming, 111 should be very evident to you.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
112 Ma l’orbita che fé la parte somma 113 di sua circunferenza, è derelitta, 114 sì ch’è la muffa dov’ era la gromma.
query.error: **English:** 112 But the orbit which made the highest part 113 of its circumference, is abandoned, 114 so that there is mold where there was the sprout.
query.result: 112 Api tu paridhiḥ yaḥ cakāra bhāgam uttamam 113 Svasya paridhiḥ, sa parityaktaḥ, 114 Yathā tatra jātaḥ śyāmaḥ, tatra jātaḥ śilājatuḥ.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.

query.error: **English:** 115 His family, who moved straight ahead 116 with their feet in his footsteps, is so turned around, 117 that the one in front throws the one behind him to the ground;

query.result: 118 Na ca cireṇa eva drśyate phalasya 119 kuśalasya vṛkṣasyāphalasya ca, yadā darbhaḥ 120 paridevayate yadi tasya bhandāgāram hṛtam.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.

query.error: **English:** 121 I say truly, that whoever should search leaf by leaf 122 our volume, would still find a page 123 where he would read "I am what I am accustomed to be";

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
124 ma non fia da Casal né d’Acquasparta, 125 là onde vegnon tali a la scrittura, 126 ch’uno la fugge e altro la coarta.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
127 Io son la vita di Bonaventura 128 da Bagnoregio, che ne’ grandi offici 129 sempre pospuosi la sinistra cura.
query.error: **English:** 127 I am the life of Bonaventure 128 from Bagnoregio, who in high offices 129 always set aside the concern for the left.
query.result: 127 Aham jīvanaṃ Bonaventura-asya 128 Bagnoregio-to yaḥ mahānteṣu kāryeṣu 129 sadā apahāsi vāmapakṣa-cintām.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.

query.result: 130 Dīptajyotir Augustinau ca iha santi, 131 Ye prathameṣu nagnapadānām daridrāṇām āsīt, 132 Ye śiroveṣṭane viṣṇoḥ sakhāḥ abhavan.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.

query.error: **English:** 136 Nathan the prophet and the metropolitan 137 Chrysostom and Anselm and that Donatus 138 who deigned to put his hand to the first art.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.

145 e mosse meco questa compagnia».
